Module com.example.batallanaval
Package com.example.batallanaval.model

Interface ILogicBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
LogicBoard, LogicBoardAdapter
public interface ILogicBoard
Interface that defines the core logic for a Battleship-style board. Provides methods for managing boats, handling user interaction, tracking shots, and managing game state.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Juan Esteban Arias, Junior Lasprilla Prada, Steven Fernando Arag√≥n

  • Method Details

    • getAvailableBoats

      ArrayList<Boat> getAvailableBoats()
      Returns the list of boats that are still available for placement on the board.
      Returns:
      A list of available Boat objects.

    • getPlacedBoats

      List<Boat> getPlacedBoats()
      Returns the list of boats that have already been placed on the board.
      Returns:
      A list of placed Boat objects.

    • selectBoat

      void selectBoat(int index)
      Selects a boat by its index in the list of available boats.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the boat to select.

    • returnBoat

      void returnBoat()
      Returns the currently selected boat back to the list of available boats.

    • emptySelectedBoat

      void emptySelectedBoat()
      Removes all segments of the currently selected boat (empties it).

    • isBoatSelected

      boolean isBoatSelected()
      Checks whether there is currently a selected boat.
      Returns:
      true if a boat is selected, false otherwise.

    • getSelectedBoat

      Boat getSelectedBoat()
      Gets the currently selected boat.
      Returns:
      The selected Boat, or null if none is selected.

    • placeBoat

      boolean placeBoat(int row, int col, Boat boat)
      Attempts to place a boat on the board at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      row - The row coordinate for placement.
      col - The column coordinate for placement.
      boat - The boat to place.
      Returns:
      true if the boat was placed successfully, false otherwise.

    • shoot

      int shoot(int row, int col)
      Shoots at a specific cell on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row to shoot at.
      col - The column to shoot at.
      Returns:
      An integer code representing the result (e.g., hit, miss, sunk).

    • findBoatAt

      Boat findBoatAt(int row, int col)
      Finds and returns the boat located at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the target cell.
      col - The column of the target cell.
      Returns:
      The Boat at the specified position, or null if none is found.

    • isPartOfBoat

      boolean isPartOfBoat(Boat boat, int row, int col)
      Checks whether a given cell is part of the specified boat.
      Parameters:
      boat - The boat to check.
      row - The row of the cell.
      col - The column of the cell.
      Returns:
      true if the cell is part of the boat, false otherwise.

    • markBoatAsSunk

      void markBoatAsSunk(Boat boat)
      Marks the specified boat as sunk.
      Parameters:
      boat - The boat to mark as sunk.

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      Checks whether the game is over (i.e., all boats have been sunk).
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise.

    • getBoard

      int[][] getBoard()
      Returns the 2D array representing the current board state.
      Returns:
      A 2D integer array representing the board.

    • reset

      void reset()
      Resets the board to its initial empty state.

    • getBoats

      List<Boat> getBoats()
      Returns all boats associated with the board (both placed and unplaced, depending on the implementation).
      Returns:
      A list of all Boat objects.

    • printBoard

      void printBoard()
      Prints the current board state to the console.

    • aleatorizeBoard

      void aleatorizeBoard()
      Randomly places all boats on the board.

    • randomShooting

      int randomShooting()
      Performs a random shot on the board.
      Returns:
      An integer code representing the result of the shot.
